61867144

This is really the bull case cry for stacking firearms and putting aside enough to buy sell swords. The government will do anything they think they can get away with which I why I don't think even bail ins are certain, you can do those overnight without kicking a single door but there will still be hell to pay in the morning. While stackers are a smaller population most holdings require, or rather will at such time require, going door to door to seize assets in a country in which one can put together an AR for $350-$400 and drop in FRTs can be had for as little as $100. All this against the population and asset class pairing most likely to own firearms. The logistics don't make sense. You'll see heavy taxes, threats of taxes, capital controls and possibly if briefly bans on sales after a set date. None of this yields as much gold or silver as paying an above market rate. Question is, is there anything worth trading for. If I got a deed to a substantial amount of the land the federal government loves to horde so much I could see myself parting with all (some) of my specie. Nobody can be all stick and no carrot and win. This is why in bank bail ins you atleast get shares in a bank that has recently defaulted.

2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave

>>ban/delete whenever they make a Nerva general
No need to when they die after two hours anyway lol
>>leave countless shit threads untouched
Most shit threads don't just push indian coins
>CPU-only alternative
Nigger, RandomX is CPU only.
>Monero is the king today, nobody denies that
Then why shit on it always? Why even try to move away from it to a clearly inferior product in every metric? Why do you need some community in the first place? We have an economy we care about.
>A privacy movement that can’t tolerate parallel projects is already compromised.
So can you tolerate our general not existing to push your cowshit coin?

61866961
>>61866885
1. Not up for us to decide
2. You already had your generals, they die out anyway and you still feel a need to infiltrate our generals.

61867018
>>61866805
>Stop talking about my coin and stop coming to my general and I will tolerate your kind
>doesnt know where hes at or what hes doing, apparently
Also, I started this general and one of the jannies banned me. Why? ban these monegros.

61867055
>>61867008

Oh yeah OP just stole the picture from a nervajeet and pretends to be oblivious to it despite being in the general in which nerva had to be mentioned over 140 times already
>They are shitting up other threads
We got inspired by you it seems. Maybe stop trying to psyop people regarding our coin.
>and advertising XMR,
We're refuting your FUD and asking you questions which you can never answer. That's because all you do is literally just put out ads for your jeetcoin
>and abusing their cuck jannie powers to ban people who disagree with them, then his little buddy starts asking me to "stop evading bans" and pretending theyre not deleting actual nerva threads.
How about the generals that don't get deleted and then die from your community consisting solely of five jeets?
>They started it the day they took a shit on someone asking about nerva and have been shitting up every non monero thread since.
Funny thing to say when nerva jeets admit to being in multiple threads not related to nerva and even pol to promote their cowshit coin
>Im sick of seeing them shit everywhere every time a privacy coin thread pops up.
Stop spreading FUD
>Either remove the XMR general for advertising,
It isn't. It's refuting your claims.
>leave privacy threads and nerva threads/anons alone.
Your kind infiltrated our thread. You are supposed to leave us alone.

>>61867018
>>doesnt know where hes at or what hes doing, apparently
I'm in the thread that just spreads fud about Monero from the very beginning.
>Why?
Because you're an obvious nervajeet that spreads FUD so his bags get bought.

61867250
>>61867201

61867425
>>61867384
>, you all didnt even post a response to the view key fud thats even worth a damn till yesterday
Check out >>61761926. What's worse is that, your cohort started with the questions from reddit but the post you mentioned had the answer THREE YEARS AGO.
Your question had been answered THREE YEARS before you even posed it. On the platform you all preferred. Have any of you gone back and said something like 'Thanks for telling me about this' or 'Well this eases my mind' or 'Guess I was wrong'? Of course not. You attached yourself to FUD so you can shill your bags. If you all cared you could've easily done the research anon did.

61867720
>>61867695

61868264
>>61867425

item.title: I almost made it 26 years ago — 19 replies — 7.7/hr
item.content:encoded:
I almost made it 26 years ago

Open thread • Replies: 19 • Updated: 2026-02-18 08:21 UTC

OP

>Be me, 14 in 2000
>Avid pc gamer and Final Fantasy 8 for PC comes out so buy nVidia TNT2 graphics card
>So impressed with card I beg parents to invest all my life savings building PC's for people and years of birthday/Christmas present in nVidia. ~$5,000.00
>Dad says yea whatever and puts it in a GIC for the next decade.
>39 now and don't even know what happened to the money. At some point they gave a bunch of my savings to my sister.
>MFW it would be worth nearly 100 milion today.

Early replies (first 3)

61868356
>>61868343
>So chuffed with his fake story he had to make an entire thread for it

Ur a faget

61868357
>>61868343
I'm sorry OP. It may be morally correct for you to do what shall not be named to your family and then to yourself.

61868363
>>61868356
Believe me or not, idgaf. Even if my parents actually made that investment for me they would have probably would have just given it to my sister anyways. At least this way I can get closure.

61868372
>>61868357

>>39 now and don't even know what happened to the money. At some point they gave a bunch of my savings to my sister.

61869233
>>61869044
do you feel suicidal everyday for not making it with bitcoin or ethereum even though you were ahead of the curve of most people

61869261
>>61868343
>hmm, today I will make up a story to impress crypto neets on /biz/

61869267
>>61868343
doesn't work like that. when you were young and needed the money you would have cashed out a 5x or whatever to buy a car. I similarly tried to buy bitcoin really early at a price that would have made me a multimillionaire, but even if i did end up buying, i would have cashed out gains when i had no job and needed the money.

The hard part actually isn't getting in early, the hard part is holding and never selling, a skill you really only learn when you are older ironically.
